relation: Created page with 'The other night, I was fortunate to come across an IT Director that has successfully migrated most of his companies Windows 7 computers to Windows 8. Luckily for me...'
pageTitle: A Windows 8 Migration Success Story - Wikibon
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {10031=What problems did you run into that you didn't anticipate? We ran into issues with some development tools, primarily the Flash Debugger for Visual Studio. Also, there was an issue installing SQL Server 2005 due to missing components of .NET Framework 3.5. We had to use a script to complete the install. This appears to be a known issue., 16084=Posted By:Bert Latamore| Thu Nov 29, 2012 11:53, 16519=Posted By:Mark Martin| Thu Apr 11, 2013 01:31}
textBeforeTable: You must be logged in to post a comment, please Sign in Post A Comment Windows 8 is really very fast and safe. He will take very less time for booting. we are using from last 2 months... Posted By:Mark Martin| Thu Apr 11, 2013 01:31 Scott, Very interesting interview. I was surprised that he said Windows 8 is more stable. I had not heard of any stability issues with Win 7. And getting faster performance with Win 8 also surprised me; I guess Microsoft has the code creep under control for once. Win 8 is supposedly designed to support a new kind of connected computing, and I wonder if your friend has plans for taking advantage of that. Posted By:Bert Latamore| Thu Nov 29, 2012 11:53 Comments on 'A Windows 8 success story and guidance'
